title: Exploring Apple TV's Black Friday Streaming Deal
summary: This article from TechRadar highlights an exceptional Black Friday promotion for Apple TV, the streaming service formerly known as Apple TV+. Normally priced at $12.99 per month in the US and £9.99 in the UK, the deal offers a 50% discount, reducing the cost to $5.99 or £4.99 per month for six months, valid until December 1, 2025. It emphasizes the value of accessing a vast library of original content, including hit shows like 'Ted Lasso', 'Severance', and 'The Morning Show', as well as upcoming exclusives such as F1 races. The service is compatible with various devices, including Apple products, smart TVs, and gaming consoles, and includes extras like MLS games. The author recommends this as a prime opportunity to subscribe, noting the timing with Black Friday sales and recent updates to the service, such as the removal of the '+' from its name.

Streaming services have become integral to modern entertainment, with platforms like Apple TV competing by offering original series and live sports. Affiliate marketing is common in online media, where sites earn commissions for driving sales. Understanding these contexts helps evaluate the article's promotion of the Apple TV deal.
